alert.note: Alert for Alamosa; Conejos; Mineral; Rio Grande (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 05 at 12:50PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...SPECIAL HYDROLOGIC OUTLOOK... This outlook is for the Rio Grande Basin in south-central Colorado, primarily for area rivers and creeks in Mineral, Rio Grande, Alamosa and Conejos Counties. This outlook is valid from May 5 to May 12, 2023. The potential for minor flooding and inundation of low-lying areas, due to accelerated snowmelt potential, is higher than normal in the Rio Grande Basin. ...OUTLOOK FOR THE NEXT 7 DAYS... The snowmelt season is well underway and snowpack in the eastern San Juan Mountains remains well above normal for this time of year. Warming temperatures and dry, windy conditions over the month of April and into early May have accelerated snowmelt rates and have produced higher than normal flows for area rivers and creeks this early in the snowmelt season. After an anticipated slowdown of snowmelt runoff over the weekend, another warming trend beginning next week will accelerate snowmelt and further cause river and creek levels to rise through the remainder of the week. This could result in bankfull flows or possible minor flooding and inundation of low-lying areas. Any snowmelt flooding that develops will most likely be minor and would only result in minimal property damage and minor public threat or inconvenience. ...ADDITIONAL INFORMATION... Visit our web site at weather.gov/pub for more hydrologic information including graphs of probabilistic river outlooks. The National Weather Service Pueblo CO hydrology page can be accessed by clicking the Rivers and Lakes tab near the top of the page.
